ai.summary: A moderate 8.9 km section of the Green Chain Walk in the UK. The route follows a steady path with gentle elevation changes and a mix of built-up and green spaces, suitable for walkers with moderate stamina.
ai.terrain_summary: Mostly well-maintained paths with a mix of pavement, compact dirt trails, and grassy sections. Expect occasional street crossings and minor gradients; footwear with good grip is recommended.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast before starting; UK conditions can change quickly. Wear sturdy footwear and bring layering, a hat and sunscreen. Stay on marked trails and beware of street crossings if the route intersects roads. Carry water and snacks, a map or GPS device, and ensure your phone is charged. Tell someone your plan and expected return time. In an emergency in the UK, call 999. Practice Leave No Trace and be mindful of wildlife.
recommended_gear: Map or GPS device (or offline map on phone)
ai.best_seasons: Late spring to early autumn; avoid wet, icy, or very windy winter conditions.
